statement:
Suppose $A$ is a square matrix depending on a real parameter $t$ taking
values in an open set $I\subseteq {\mathbbmss{R}}$. Further, suppose all
component functions in $A$ are differentiable, and $A(t)$ is invertible
for all $t$. Then, in $I$, we have
$$\frac{dA^{-1}}{dt}=-A^{-1} \frac{dA}{dt} A^{-1},$$ where
$\frac{d}{dt}$ is the derivative.

Suppose $a_{ij}(t)$ are the component functions for $A$, and $a^{jk}(t)$
are component functions for $A^{-1}(t)$. Then for each $t$ we have
$$\sum_{j=1}^n a_{ij}(t) a^{jk}(t)=\delta_i^k$$ where $n$ is the order
of $A$, and $\delta_i^k$ is the Kronecker delta symbol. Hence
$$\sum_{j=1}^n \frac{da_{ij}}{dt} a^{jk} + a_{ij}\frac{da^{jk}}{dt} = 0,$$
that is, $$\frac{dA}{dt} A^{-1} = - A \frac{dA^{-1}}{dt}$$ from which
the claim follows.
